page.title: 04W. Ashby church/yard survey.
page.content: The Church of All Saints is in the perpendicular style, built in the reign of Henry V11. It consists of a large chancel, nave, north aisle and square embattled and pinnacled tower, with bells. It contains several monu- ments to the Rockcliffe family. The Bishop of Carlisle is the appropriator and patron of the church.The register dates from 1561.In 1873 the church was completely restored and reseated, the Â£375 tower resoration cost being born by Mrs Basset, daughter of William Elmhirst Esq, in memory of Mrs Barnard - Charlotte Pye of Louth - who under the name of Claribel was a well known Victorian ballad song writer.In 1982 W.Ashby W.I.compiled a list of grave stone inscriptions, for the Lincs History & Archaeology Soc.the earliest recored being of Richard Drewery died 1717,latest Irene Simpson, died 1961.
